title: general purpose serif typeface for a law office
content:
I’d like to hear some suggestions regarding a general purpose serif typeface for a lawyers office, to be used in all sorts of laser-printed legal papers, letters, and so on. Classic, but not overused. With a distinct, but not obtrusive, character. Small caps and fixed width figures must be available.

Thanks in advance.

 [‹ Font recommendation?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032507/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44790 "Go to previous forum topic") [Editorial- What does it mean? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032507/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44844 "Go to next forum topic")
author: pedrorf

comments.content: Hi Pedro, check out this related thread: [Modern serif typeface for a law firm](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905032507/http:/www.typophile.com/node/40792).
